subject: Re: [junit] Re: Junit noClass Def Error
msgSnippet: A few things: 1. Rename c: junit3.8.1 junit3.8.1 to just c: junit3.8.1. That s just confusing. 2. junit.jar must be on the CLASSPATH and fully-qualified, which
messageBody:
A few things:

1. Rename c:\junit3.8.1\junit3.8.1 to just c:\junit3.8.1. That's just
confusing.
2. junit.jar must be on the CLASSPATH and fully-qualified, which you
have.
3. The tests are in the package junit.tests, so the folder CONTAINING
the tree junit/tests/* must be on the CLASSPATH. In my case, it's
d:\junit3.8.1.
4. Don't set your CLASSPATH using environment variables. Write a shell
script and launch it when you launch your Command Prompt. The cleaner
your environment, the better. :)

Good luck.

So said Ro <rrt24@...> on 2003-01-27 --------------------

>Hi-it still doesn't work. i hope you mind me being tedious and going
>into more detail....
>
>I installed Junit to C:\junit3.8.1\junit3.8.1 in which all the java
>doc and jar files are.
>
>So i set my classpath [done in windows ME in the environment\path]
>as:
>
>C:\junit3.8.1\junit3.8.1;C:\junit3.8.1\junit3.8.1\junit.jar;
>C:\junit3.8.1
>
>
>i think this is what you told me to do but it still gives the same
>exceptions
>
>:(
>
>Regards,
>Ro
>
>
>
>
>
>--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Jason Rogers" <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:
>> Your classpath needs to include the directory that includes
>the 'junit'
>> directory, not the 'junit' directory itself.
>>
>>
>> =jason
>> [:question | ^One]
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Ro <rrt24@c...> [mailto:rrt24@c...]
>> Sent: Monday, January 27, 2003 11:52 AM
>> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>> Subject: [junit] Junit noClass Def Error
>>
>>
>> Hi-i have read the documentation, installed junit3.8.1 and set my
>> classpaths properly. still i get the error:
>>
>> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
>> junit/textui/TestRunner
>>
>> and
>>
>> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
>> junit/samples/Alltests
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> When i try to test the sample classes. My classpaths refer to the
>> whole junit directory, and i even tried putting in individual paths
>> to all the executable jar files i could find in the release.
>>
>> Whats wrong???????
>> it doesn't say anywhere??
>>
>> Regards,
>> Ro
>>
